# Data Wrangling

Last compiled: 2024-05-18

I had to use the reduced data, because my computer could not load the original patent data.

# Challenge No. 01
## Patent Dominance



::: {.cell hash='03_data_wrangling_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_a6663a3357e86e2c46217eac83429b83'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# 01 Load libraries ----

library(vroom)
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```

```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# 02 Wrangling Data ----
col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  date = col_date("%Y-%m-%d"),
  num_claims = col_double()
)

patent_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/patent.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)

col_types <- list(
  id = col_character(),
  type = col_character(),
  organization = col_character()
)

assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)

col_types <- list(
  patent_id = col_character(),
  assignee_id = col_character()
)

patent_assignee_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/patent_assignee.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)

col_types <- list(
  patent_id = col_character(),
  mainclass_id = col_character(),
  sequence = col_integer()
)

uspc_tbl <- vroom(
  file       = "Patent_data_reduced/uspc.tsv", 
  delim      = "\t", 
  col_types  = col_types,
  na         = c("", "NA", "NULL")
)

US_top_10 <- patent_assignee_tbl %>%
  group_by(assignee_id) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(count)) %>%
  left_join(assignee_tbl, c("assignee_id" = "id"))

Challange_1 <- US_top_10$organization %>%
  head(n=50)
Challange_1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

# Challenge No. 02
## Recent Patent Activity (2014 Aug)



::: {.cell hash='03_data_wrangling_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_c761df9f48b2db3369806cc4e069d26d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
S_2014_05 <- patent_tbl %>%
  filter(date >= "2014-05-01" & date < "2014-06-01") %>%
  left_join(patent_assignee_tbl, c("id" = "patent_id")) %>%
  left_join(assignee_tbl, c("assignee_id" = "id")) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  group_by(organization) %>%
  summarize(count =n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(count))

Challange_2 <-S_2014_05$organization %>%
  head(n=10)
Challange_2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>  [1] "International Business Machines Corporation"
#>  [2] "Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd."              
#>  [3] "Canon Kabushiki Kaisha"                     
#>  [4] "Microsoft Corporation"                      
#>  [5] "Sony Corporation"                           
#>  [6] "Kabushiki Kaisha Toshiba"                   
#>  [7] "Panasonic Corporation"                      
#>  [8] "QUALCOMM Incorporated"                      
#>  [9] "Apple Inc."                                 
#> [10] "Google Inc."
```
:::
:::

Table 2: Top 10 US companies with the most new granted patents in 2014 Aug.


# Challenge No. 03
## Innovation in Tech



::: {.cell hash='03_data_wrangling_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_4b98cda82de8e207ae9ccf50c433d9b5'}

```{.r .cell-code}
Top_mainclasses <- uspc_tbl %>%
  inner_join(patent_assignee_tbl, c("patent_id" = "patent_id")) %>%
  inner_join(assignee_tbl, c("assignee_id"= "id")) %>%
  group_by(mainclass_id) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(count)) %>%
  head(n=5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> Warning in inner_join(., patent_assignee_tbl, c(patent_id = "patent_id")): Detected an unexpected many-to-many relationship between `x` and `y`.
#> ℹ Row 16 of `x` matches multiple rows in `y`.
#> ℹ Row 197969 of `y` matches multiple rows in `x`.
#> ℹ If a many-to-many relationship is expected, set `relationship =
#>   "many-to-many"` to silence this warning.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
Challange_3 <- Top_mainclasses$mainclass_id %>%
  head(n=5)
Challange_3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "257" "455" "370" "438" "709"
```
:::
:::

Table 3: Top 5 USPTO mainclasses for the worlds top ten companies.(descending order)
